availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, and Charlestown, Indiana, attorney. Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, native. Married to Mary W. Goodwin in 1838. Father of Lydia D. Gibson, Amelia A. Gibson, Thomas W. Gibson, Sarah G. Gibson, Charles H. Gibson, and George H. D. Gibson. Attended the United States Military Academy at West Point, New York. Midshipman in the United States Navy from 1833 to 1836. Studied law under George H. Dunn in Lawrenceburg, Indiana, in 1836. Practiced law in Charlestown, Indiana until 1846. Captain in the 3rd Indiana Volunteer Infantry Regiment from 1846 to 1847. Elected as a Democrat to the House of Representatives of the State of Indiana in 1848. Member of the Senate of the State of Indiana. Began practicing law in Louisville in 1852.

ab.bibl: Lewis C. Baird, Bairdâ€™s History of Clark County, Indiana (Clark County: Unigraphic, 1909), 817. Find A Grave, "Thomas Ware Gibson (1815-1876)," Memorial #85756213, https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=85756213&ref=acom (accessed July, 11, 2017).
